comments:
Hello,

There are several cases where the caller would pass in null as the exception like the following.
   StatusUtil.newStatus(IStatus.ERROR, message, null)
where message is null.

In this case, a NullPointerException would occur as it trying to get message from exception (null).


java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.misc.StatusUtil.newStatus(StatusUtil.java:74)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPlugin.log(WorkbenchPlugin.java:546)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressMonitorFocusJobDialog$12.run(ProgressMonitorFocusJobDialog.java:384)
	at org.eclipse.swt.custom.BusyIndicator.showWhile(BusyIndicator.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressMonitorFocusJobDialog.show(ProgressMonitorFocusJobDialog.java:377)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManager.showInDialog(ProgressManager.java:1019)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManager$2.runInUIThread(ProgressManager.java:384)
	at org.eclipse.ui.progress.UIJob$1.run(UIJob.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2480)
FYI you shouldn't be using internal classes.  We make no guarantee that these work outside of our own use cases.
OOops, my bad - sorry about that.

This is now obsolete. We no longer have this code pattern in this class.
If this happens in version 3.2 or later please reopen (with the full .log if possible).
